title.rendered: Imad Wasim ruled out of Pakistan’s World Cup 2024 opener against USA.

content.rendered:
Pakistan pacer Imad Wasim has been ruled out of the upcoming T20 World Cup match against the United States of America (USA). The event took place at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas on June 6.

The all-rounder who recently came out of international retirement and was selected in Pakistan’s squad for the 2024 World Cup, has been a top-tier performer, especially in franchise cricket, and it is expected that he will do a great job for it. team and competition.

Pakistan captain Babar Azam has confirmed that Imad Wasim is unavailable for the tournament in the United States due to a side problem. But he expects all players to be fit for the internationals.

“Imad Wasim is facing a second problem. This unfortunately will not be available for our opening game. Although Imad will not play the first match. We hope he will join the team in other matches,” said Babar Azam.

Imad Wasim was not included in the playing XI for the fourth T201 against England recently. The spinners bowled the second match, with figures of 2-19 and a 22-run cameo.

He played a vital role in Pakistan’s semi-final run in the T20 World Cup 2021. During this campaign, he took four wickets in six matches at an economy rate of just 5.70.

Pakistan’s spin bowling is winning without Imad Wasim

Pakistan can rely on their attacking four for bowling because their batting quarterback lives and dies on Imad Wasim. Shadab Khan’s terrible form, coupled with Abrar Ahmed’s experience at the international level, is a concern. The Men in Green have opted not to pick Usama Mir. And their alternative comes in the form of shortstop Iftikhar Ahmed.

Pakistan will be hoping that Wasim returns to full fitness as soon as possible, as he is lined up to face rivals India after their draw with the United States. The high-profile tournament will take place on Sunday, May 9 at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.
